page.title: 11SAINT CATHERINE'S HILL
page.content: At St Catherine's hill are Iron-age earthworks,Bronze age burial mounds,a Roman fort and 2 Reservoirs.{THE {IRONAGE EARTHWORKS}Built about 50 B.C.,too small to have been a fort,was possibly a cattle enclosure. It was oval in shape.{THE ROMAN FORT Built about (50A.D.)probably a fort because of military pottery found there.It had a view over the Stour river and a Roman road leading to a place where the Avon could be seen. Also the main trackways could be seen so it controlled all the major routes over and around St Catherine's hill. {THE BRONZE AGE BURIAL MOUNDS}Built about (500B.C.) rest on a ridge on the hill to be seen,otherwise very little known.{THE RESERVOIRS}Built 1940-1950's One is a huge concrete drum and the other a huge roughly rectangular shaped concrete building.
